info.title: Swagger Petstore - OpenAPI 3.0
info.description:
This is a sample Pet Store Server based on the OpenAPI 3.0 specification.  You can find out more about
Swagger at [http://swagger.io](http://swagger.io). In the third iteration of the pet store, we've switched to the design first approach!
You can now help us improve the API whether it's by making changes to the definition itself or to the code.
That way, with time, we can improve the API in general, and expose some of the new features in OAS3.

Some useful links:
- [The Pet Store repository](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-petstore)
- [The source API definition for the Pet Store](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-petstore/blob/master/src/main/resources/openapi.yaml)

get.description: Get current system maintenance status. A status value of 0 means the system is functioning properly, a status value of 1 means the trading services are under maintenance and a status value of 2 means the system is under maintenance.
Retrieve a list of Spot and USDT perpetual instruments.
Get the available tokens that WOO X supports.
Get the available networks for each token as well as the deposit/withdrawal information.
Retrieve spot token information.
Get the latest market trades. In the response, a source of 1 means these are internal trades on WOO X and a source of 0 means they are external trades from aggregated sources.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Numbers of trades you want to query. Maximum of 1000 trades allowed.

get.description: Get historical market trades data. In the response, a source of 1 means these are internal trades on WOO X and a source of 0 means they are external trades from aggregated sources.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The id cursor for fetching the previous page of results, excluding the trade associated with the cursor itself.  Either before or after can be specified.  If both are provided, before takes precedence. If neither is passed, the results default to starting from the most recent trades.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The id cursor for fetching the next page of results, excluding the trade associated with the cursor itself.  Either before or after can be specified.  If both are provided, before takes precedence. If neither is passed, the results default to starting from the most recent trades.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Numbers of trades you want to query. Maximum of 1000 trades allowed.

get.description: Get the snapshot of the symbol order book. Price of asks/bids are in descending order.

parameters.name: maxLevel
parameters.description: Maximum number of levels to show on both sides

get.description: Get the latest klines of the trading instrument.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Numbers of klines. Maximum of 1000 klines allowed.

get.description: Get the historical klines of the trading instrument.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: The start timestamp cursor for fetching the previous page of results, excluding the kline associated with the cursor itself.  Either before or after can be specified.  If both are provided, before takes precedence. If neither is passed, the results default to starting from the most recent kline.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The start timestamp cursor for fetching the next page of results, excluding the kline associated with the cursor itself.  Either before or after can be specified.  If both are provided, before takes precedence. If neither is passed, the results default to starting from the most recent kline.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Numbers of klines you want to query. Maximum of 1000 klines allowed.

get.description: Get predicted funding rate and the latest funding rate.
Get funding rate history for one market.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Start timestamp in Unix timestamp format in milliseconds

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: End timestamp in Unix timestamp format in milliseconds

get.description: Get basic futures information for all the markets.
Get the insurance fund balance by perp contract.
get order
get orders
get order
get order
Get referral information from each user you has referred.111

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: the page you wish to query.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: the page size you wish to query, default = 25, 1000 at max.

get.description: get token history
get account level default margin mode

orderId.description: Id of the order; Either orderId or clientOrderId is required. If both are passed, orderId will be used.

clientOrderId.description: Client order Id as assigned by the user; Either orderId or clientOrderId is required. If both are passed, orderId will be used.

withRealizedPnl.description: Whether to return orders realized pnl; Note that realized PnL is only calculated for Perpetual close orders.

orderId.description: Id of the order; Either orderId or clientOrderId is required. If both are passed, orderId will be used.

clientOrderId.description: Client order Id as assigned by the user; Either orderId or clientOrderId is required. If both are passed, orderId will be used.

price.description: Only applicable to LIMIT/IOC/FOK/POST_ONLY orders;  MARKET/ASK/BID orders will ignore this field

quantity.description: Either quantity or amount is required;  If both are passed, the request will be rejected

orderTag.description: Optional tag for this order, max string length: 64

positionSide.description: Position side; The default is BOTH in the one way mode;  Can only be LONG or SHORT in the hedge mode.  Only applicable to perpetual instruments.

price.description: Only applicable to LIMIT/IOC/FOK/POST_ONLY orders;  MARKET/ASK/BID orders will ignore this field

quantity.description: Either quantity or amount is required;  If both are passed, the request will be rejected

amount.description: Only applicable to MARKET/ASK/BID orders on spot instruments;  Either quantity or amount is required;  If both are passed, the request will be rejected

reduceOnly.description: Only applicable to perpetual instruments; Whether the order can only reduce in position size; valid options are true/false

visibleQuantity.description: The order quantity visible on orderbook

orderId.description: Id of the order; Either orderId or clientOrderId is required. If both are passed, orderId will be used.

clientOrderId.description: Client order Id as assigned by the user; Either orderId or clientOrderId is required. If both are passed, orderId will be used.

positionSide.description: BOTH for one way mode; LONG or SHORT for hedge mode;  Only applicable to perpetual instruments

withRealizedPnl.description: Whether to return orders realized pnl; Note that realized PnL is only calculated for Perpetual close orders.

startTime.description: Start timestamp in Unix timestamp format in milliseconds

endTime.description: End timestamp in Unix timestamp format in milliseconds

algoType.description:
STOP: stop market / stop limit order
OCO: one-cancels-the-other order
TRAILING_STOP: trailing stop order 
POSITIONAL_TP_SL: TP/SL that closes the full position
TP_SL: TP/SL that closes a specified quantity
BRACKET: bracket order with limit or market order as the initial order and an attached POSITIONAL_TP_SL or TP_SL order
STOP_BRACKET: bracket order with stop market or stop limit order as the initial order and an attached POSITIONAL_TP_SL or TP_SL order

clientAlgoOrderId.description: Client algo order Id as assigned by the user

algoOrderTag.description: An optional tag for this order, max string length: 64

side.description: BUY/SELL, not required for POSITIONAL_TP_SL or TP_SL order

positionSide.description: BOTH for one way mode; LONG or SHORT for hedge mode;  Only applicable to perpetual instruments

quantity.description: Order quantity, not required for POSITIONAL_TP_SL order

visibleQuantity.description: The order quantity shown on orderbook;  for POSITIONAL_TP_SL order, visibleQuantity applies directly to the child orders

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

price.description: Order price, only applicable to LIMIT type

reduceOnly.description: Only applicable to perpetual instruments; whether the order can only reduce in position size; valid options are true/false

price.description: Order price, only applicable to LIMIT type

reduceOnly.description: Only applicable to perpetual instruments; whether the order can only reduce in position size; valid options are true/false

childOrders.description: Details of the other order (i.e. the trigger order)

side.description: BUY/SELL; required to be the same as the side of the LIMIT order

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

type.description: Order type of the trigger order, LIMIT/MARKET

price.description: Order price of the trigger order, only applicable if it's a LIMIT order

callbackRate.description: Either callbackValue or callbackRate is required;  If both are passed, the request will be rejected

callbackValue.description: Either callbackValue or callbackRate is required;  If both are passed, the request will be rejected

reduceOnly.description: Only applicable to perpetual instruments; whether the order can only reduce in position size; valid options are true/false

childOrders.description: Details of the positional TP/SL information, can contain at most 1 TAKE_PROFIT and 1 STOP_LOSS

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

childOrders.description: Details of the TP/SL information, can contain at most 1 TAKE_PROFIT and 1 STOP_LOSS

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

price.description: Order price, only applicable if LIMIT order

reduceOnly.description: Only applicable to perpetual instruments; whether the LIMIT/MARKET order can only reduce in position size; only support false for BRACKET orders

childOrders.description: Attached TP/SL orders, only support 1 set of POSITIONAL_TP_SL or TP_SL

side.description: Required to be SELL if side of the initial order is BUY;  Required to be BUY if side of the initial order is SELL

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

type.description: CLOSE_POSITION for POSITIONAL_TP_SL; MARKET for TP_SL

price.description: Order price, only applicable if LIMIT order

reduceOnly.description: Only applicable to perpetual instruments; whether the LIMIT/MARKET order can only reduce in position size; only support false for STOP_BRACKET orders

triggerPrice.description: Trigger price of the initial stop order

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type of the initial stop order, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

childOrders.description: Attached TP/SL orders, only support 1 set of POSITIONAL_TP_SL or TP_SL
Details of the TP/SL information, can contain at most 1 TAKE_PROFIT and 1 STOP_LOSS

side.description: Required to be SELL if side of the initial order is BUY;  Required to be BUY if side of the initial order is SELL

triggerPriceType.description: Trigger price type, currently only support MARKET_PRICE (i.e. last price)

type.description: CLOSE_POSITION for POSITIONAL_TP_SL; MARKET for TP_SL

algoOrderId.description: Id of the algoorder; Either algoOrderId or clientAlgoOrderId is required. If both are passed, algoOrderId will be used.

clientAlgoOrderId.description: Client order Id as assigned by the user; Either algoOrderId or clientAlgoOrderId is required. If both are passed, algoOrderId will be used.

leverage.description: For margin mode: 3, 4, 5, 10; for futures mode: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, 40, 50

start_filter.name: startTime
start_filter.description: start www time in unix timestamp

page_filter.name: page
page_filter.description: the page you wish to query.

size_filter.name: size
size_filter.description: the page size you wish to query, default = 25, 1000 at max.
